CatDescriptText: Mr. Thomas H. Banks, operator, shoe repair shop, 2124 Wylie Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 29, 1959, pg. A1 with question: Do you believe the state and city FEPC laws are helping Negroes to get jobs they never held before?" answer reads: "I can't see where Negroes are advancing under these laws."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Thomas H. Banks, operator of shoe repair shop, wearing light colored short sleeved striped shirt, 2124 Wylie Avenue
